text: Do you know about the old woman who lives in a shoe?”
There was an old woman who lived in a shoe,
She had so many children, and loved them all, too.
She said, "Thank you God, for sending them bread."
Then kissed them all gladly and sent them to bed.
And when the little children woke up in the shoe,
They ate at a table, with food the woman grew.
They did all their homework ,together in the heel.
The toe was their playroom they jumped, laughed and squealed.
There was an old woman who lived in a shoe,
She had so many children, and loved them all, too.
She said, "Thank you God, for sending them bread."
Then kissed them all gladly and sent them to bed.
“Isn’t the old woman in the shoe and her children simply wonderful!”
